trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with RightAnswers | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with RightAnswers | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use RightAnswers with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use RightAnswers with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and RightAnswers.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and RightAnswers.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A RightAnswers single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A RightAnswers single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to RightAnswers will be able to single sign into the application using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to RightAnswers will be able to single sign into the application using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for RightAnswers
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for RightAnswers

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for RightAnswers.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for RightAnswers.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type RightAnswers.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type RightAnswers.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select RightAnswers, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select RightAnswers, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to RightAnswers with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to RightAnswers with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the RightAnswers application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the RightAnswers application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to RightAnswers page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to RightAnswers page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App Settings page, in the Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign-on to your RightAnswers application (e.g.: https://fortify.rightanswers.com/portal/ss/), and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App Settings page, in the Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign-on to your RightAnswers application (e.g.: https://fortify.rightanswers.com/portal/ss/), and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at RightAnswers page, to download your metadata, click Download metadata, and then save the metadata file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at RightAnswers page, to download your metadata, click Download metadata, and then save the metadata file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Send the downloaded metadata file to your RightAnswers support team.
trans-unit.target: Send the downloaded metadata file to your RightAnswers support team.

trans-unit.source: Your RightAnswers support team has to do the actual SSO configuration.
trans-unit.target: Your RightAnswers support team has to do the actual SSO configuration.

trans-unit.source: You will get a notification when SSO has been enabled for your subscription.
trans-unit.target: You will get a notification when SSO has been enabled for your subscription.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into RightAnswers, they must be provisioned into RightAnswers.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into RightAnswers, they must be provisioned into RightAnswers.

trans-unit.source: In the case of RightAnswers, provisioning is an automated task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of RightAnswers, provisioning is an automated task.

trans-unit.source: There is no action item for you.
trans-unit.target: There is no action item for you.

trans-unit.source: Users are automatically created if necessary during the first single sign-on attempt.
trans-unit.target: Users are automatically created if necessary during the first single sign-on attempt.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other RightAnswers user account creation tools or APIs provided by RightAnswers to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other RightAnswers user account creation tools or APIs provided by RightAnswers to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the RightAnswers **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the RightAnswers **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
